# Reference

## Table of Contents

**Classes**

* [`zsh`](#zsh): Install zsh packages
* [`zsh::params`](#zshparams): Default parameter values

## Classes

### zsh

Install zsh packages

#### Examples

##### Basic usage

```puppet
include zsh
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `zsh` class.

##### `zshpackage`

Data type: `String[1]`

The name of the package to be installed

Default value: $zsh::params::zshpackage

##### `zshpath`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

The path to the zsh binary once installed

Default value: $zsh::params::zshpath

##### `ensure`

Data type: `Any`

This value is passed directly to the package resouce for $zshpackage.
See here for valid values:
https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/latest/types/package.html#package-attribute-ensure

Default value: installed

### zsh::params

Default parameter values
